Question 40.Question: Please describe any differences in how it impacted your learning (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 40.Response: Tutors are much more involved in the learning experience compared to lecturers. GenAI has the advantage of personally being able to answer a question that is unique to you, whereas the teacher must be strategic so as to give all students equal opportunity for feedback.

Question 41.Question: Were there any differences in how the feedback made you feel (comparing GenAI and your teacher)?
Question 41.Response: The depth and quality of teacher feedback is usually more directed and specific. Whereas AI tends to present general but superficial answers.

Question 42.Question: Describe any other differences between the feedback you received from GenAI and your teacher.
Question 42.Response: GenAI is much more suited to providing information in different ways than the initial way it was presented. Unfortunately, it is also very confident in answers that are objectively wrong. When corrected, it will not seek out new information. I.e. it doesn't learn in real time (at least from my experience)
